com.xhive.dom.interfaces
Interface XhiveBlobNodeIf

All Superinterfaces:
Node, XhiveLibraryChildIf, XhiveLockingContextIf, XhiveNodeIf
public interface XhiveBlobNodeIf
extends XhiveLibraryChildIf

This interface provides access to blobs in X-Hive/DB. Blobs are created with the XhiveLibraryIf.createBlob() method.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0

Method Detail

setContents

void setContents(java.io.InputStream blobInputStream)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Set the contents for the blob using the specified input stream.

Parameters:
blobInputStream - The input stream to read the blob contents from.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If reading from the blobInputStream throws an IOException.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0

setContents

java.io.OutputStream setContents()
Gets a java.io.OutputStream that can be used to set the blob contents. Calling this method will clear any current contents. Any data written to the returned output stream will be put in the blob. The contents cannot be read before the output stream is closed. If the output stream is not closed before the transaction is committed, the contents are lost.

Returns:
A java.io.OutputStream to set the blob contents.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0

getContents

java.io.InputStream getContents()
Get a new input stream to read the contents of the blob. The input stream should not be used after a subsequent call to setContents(java.io.InputStream) on the same blob. The skip method of the input stream does not read any actual data, so you can get reasonable random access performance by calling this method and skipping to the desired data. The input stream supports marks with unlimited readlimit (the readlimit argument to mark is ignored).

Returns:
A java.io.InputStream with the contents of the blob.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0

getSize

long getSize()
Get the size of the blob.

Returns:
The size of the blob in bytes.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0

writeTo

void writeTo(java.io.OutputStream out)
             throws java.io.IOException
Write blob contents directly to the outputstream.

Parameters:
out - The stream to write the content to.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Only if the outputstream passed throws an IOException.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0
